Jackson views the role of government as primarily serving the people and the environment, not corporations, and disagrees with the statement that all people in society have equal opportunities. Eco-anarchist Jackson Storm believes that a world without any form of government will lead to greater personal freedoms and autonomy, with the emergence of self-governing communities. He sees a world without government as an opportunity for direct action towards environmental preservation and the protection of universal rights, free from the constraints and bureaucracy of established institutions.
